tool.name: Protein Prophet
tool.description: Calculate Protein Prophet statistics on search results

param.name: input_file
param.label: Peptide Prophet Results
param.help: These files will typically be outputs from peptide prophet or interprophet

param.name: nooccam
param.label: Don't apply Occam's razor
param.help: When selected no attempt will be made to derive the simplest protein list explaining observed peptides

param.name: groupwts
param.label: Use group weights
param.help: Check peptide's total weight (rather than actual weight) in the Protein Group against the threshold

param.name: logprobs
param.label: Use the log of probability in the confidence calculations

param.name: confem
param.label: Use the EM to compute probability given the confidenct

param.name: allpeps
param.label: Consider all possible peptides in the database in the confidence model

param.name: instances
param.label: Use Expected Number of Ion Instances to adjust the peptide probabilities prior to NSP adjustment

param.name: delude
param.label: Do NOT use peptide degeneracy information when assessing proteins

param.name: minprob
param.label: Minimum peptide prophet probability for peptides to be considered

param.name: minindep
param.label: Minimum percentage of independent peptides required for a protein

tool.help:
**What it does**
Given a set of peptide assignments from MS/MS spectra in the form of a pepXML file, this tool estimates probabilities at the protein level. As output, the tool produces a protXML file, which contains proteins along with the estimated probabilities that those proteins were present. Probabilities are estimated using a statistical model based on the number of peptides corresponding to that protein and the confidence that each of those peptides were assigned correctly. It takes account of the fact that peptides may correspond to more than one protein.
----
**Citation**
If you use this tool please read and cite the paper describing the statistical model implemented by Protein Prophet
Nesvizhskii A., et al. “A Statistical Model for Identifying Proteins by Tandem Mass Spectrometry” *Anal. Chem.* 75, 4646-4658 (2003).
